ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1 hour per week
several. Maybe 2-3 hours per week
2-4 hours
3-4 hours
2-3 hours
3-4 hours
1 to 2.
7 hours

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: A good summary of occupational and environmental medicine.

I thought this was a great introductory course with amazing guest lectures. It was a great combination of guest lectures and lectures with the primary instructors. The information was very interesting and the papers were good to finish the class with by discussing them. I think the strengths include the classes in which we did exclusively case-studies and discussed them. I think the only weakness would be that the organization was not well-laid out; I wish there was more structure in terms of weekly expectations/quizzes and the midterm.
boring lectures, but somewhat valuable material. would have taken another course if wasnt required
This is a easy class, good chance to learn something new and get "H"
omnibus lectures by different instructors
The material was relevant and fun to learn. All of the resources were accessible and helpful.
Terrific class. Good guest speakers.Need a classroom. Library was too small for number of students taking the course.
Excellent course, very relevant to clinical medicine.

Interesting course that covered broad topics in occupational medicine. I appreciated the overview of the breadth of the field, and understanding the role that occupational physicians and industrial hygienists play in the workplace. I felt that the articles chosen to read were all quite good, but the textbook reading was sometimes quite long and I didn't get a lot out of it.

The course was initially difficult to follow because the basics of the course were somewhat dry. The course improved after including many different speakers, each with different teaching styles which made the class more enjoyable. The flexibility of grading regarding the pop quiz was appreciated. The only thing that I would change is that the popquiz is only given in the first few minutes of the class except to those who come late. Since some classmates come far away places, or have to find places to park or other deterrents to going to class on time, there should be some exceptions made. The course work was very manageable. The only other thing that I would change is making sure that the lectures have less acronyms and have more easily defined occupational and medical terms for those with limited backgrounds in each.
A great course. There are many guest speakers whose lectures are replete with many real-life examples.
Great lecturers.
Very Good
The amount of reading seemed excessive, but it was a great foundation for the environmental health sciences
Nice introductory course. The textbook was an easy read and provided a good framework. I liked having various instructors throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Good lecturer, made the key points about occupational medicine clear and was able to describe the practice of occupational medicine well.

Instructor: Carrie Redlich  I thought she was a great lecturer and was helpful in answering all of our questions during class. She was approachable and geared lectures towards not only the physicians or public health students, but also undergraduates. I don't think there was any way he instructor could have bettered her teaching.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  good
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  good teacher, well organized lectures
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Good professor
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  She was helpful and had clear lectures.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Super.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Both Redlick and Merideth were great instructors, very enthusiastic about the material and made learning the material alot of fun aswell!
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Good, informative, interactive lectures!
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  She taught the information in an easy to follow format. I think that she should have more class interaction with her lectures.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Good lecturer.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Excellent
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  She was a wonderful, very enthusiastic, and sensitive to our needs.
Instructor: Carrie Redlich  Very knowledgeable and approachable. I liked her teaching style.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Mostly was a secondary instructor but made the key points of application of epidemiology to occupational medicine.

Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Professor Stowe was very informative and gave great lectures; I really understood and retained the information that she lectured on. If a student had a question after class, she was helpful and if she didn't know the answer pursued it further by asking someone else in the department. I thought this was great. The powerpoints were great for the material.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  good
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  good lectures and organization
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Warm personality
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  She was always available for questions and was passionate about the material.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Super.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  see above
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Really knew what she was talking about in the field and provided good structure for the course.

Instructor: Meredith Stowe  She did a great job of making sure that everyone was following the material that was being taught. When we do the literature reviews, it would be great is she could spend more time on going in deeper to explaining techniques and methods of the authors and why they may be helpful from a public health standpoint.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Fantastic, always present, always available for questions. Very knowledgable.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  Excellent
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  She was extremely helpful and always available to us.
Instructor: Meredith Stowe  I liked her perspective and teaching style. I think she did a good job of connecting with the students.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: For me it was one choice in a group of required courses, none of which were directly relevant to my areas of interest. It was therefore likely the best alternative because there were some interesting facts learned with at most a moderate workload.

This course is a great introduction to the field of occupational and environmental medicine. It ties in many aspects of medicine already learned, but from a new perspective. The guest lectures are great and you learn a lot.
too early in the morning, very stuffy room. take it for an easy class, not much to learn

This is a interesting and relaxed course. The only thing you have to do is attend the lectues and spend some time to do the reading when you are tired of other classed and need a break. The exam is quite reasonable, you can even answer it just with your intuition.
Recommend this class to colleagues
I loved this course and I believe it is relevant to anyone wishing to work in the public health field.
Great course taught in a relaxed environment.
Yes. Great course and lots to learn.

Overview of issues in occupational medicine. Gave a good sense of how the field functions and the role that these professionals play in protecting health in the workplace. I would recommend it to other students.

This course is a great taste of the world of occupational medicine and is like a great intro course for those interested in medical school. I would definitely recommend this course to other students, especially since the material is taught at the beginners level. The instructors are very knowledgeable and approachable and willing to help.
If you want a sneak-peak into the world of occupational medicine and train yourself to view real-life situations with an occupational perspective, I would highly recommend this course.
Great class.
I would highly recommend this course. It was interesting and really incorporated concepts from all of our environmental classes.
Nice introductory course. Easy to read textbook. Reasonable midterm and final exam expectations.
